climbs.name: Weasels Ripped My Flesh
climbs.fa: Peter Hubbel, Claude Traufield, Deaun Schovajsa, 1985

content.description: Climb through off fingers for a few moves, then follow the hand crack as it traverses right. It is pumpy and climbs as good as it looks. Build an anchor on top, and scramble back down to the gully.
content.protection: Cams from 0.4 to #3 with doubles 0.5 to #2.
content.location:
This beautiful crack is technically on Weasel Wock, but I thought it would be best added here, since it is right next to The Aerie. Find the gully on the opposite side of the formation as the

Trophy

(closer to the rest of The Boulder Pile). The route is obvious once you're there.

climbs.name: The Trophy (on The Aerie)
climbs.fa: Noel Childs, Brett Bristol, Marion Durr, and John Durr, 1987

content.description: The crux comes right off the ground trying to navigate some offwidth step-around move.  After that, it's a pleasant 5.10 crack for well over 100'.  A souvenir awaits at the top.
content.protection: A double set of Camalots through #3, 1 #4, and a rack of Big Bros.
content.location: This climb is located on the east side and is characterized by a wide start coming out an overhang.  After this the size diminishes as you move up.  We walked off to the north as the summit equipment was unsafe.  You could move off to the west for Weasels?
